title: Trump announces federal takeover of DC police citing Coristine attack
summary:
Trump announced federal takeover of Washington DC police department and deployment of
National Guard, using the assault on Edward Coristine as justification. Trump stated he
was considering "having his administration take over the DC Police Department" and
bringing in National Guard. This represented unprecedented federal control over the
nation's capital's local law enforcement, exploiting a single assault incident despite
crime being at 30-year lows.

sources.title: Trump reignites threat to take over DC after former DOGE worker assaulted
Trump threatens federal takeover of DC after attack on former DOGE worker

notes:
Trump's announcement came two days after Coristine assault. Despite DC Mayor's objections
and constitutional questions about federal authority over local policing, Trump proceeded
with deployment plans. By August 11, 1,450+ Guard troops from multiple states were
deployed to DC. This marked first federal takeover of capital's police since Reconstruction.
